original: GENBERG, Erik Waldemar, Civilingenjör, Norrköping, f Solna, Sthlms l, 22/9 99 av överste K A G o Gerda Högman, gm Maria Heist. Studex Kristianstad 17, KTH (kemi) 19—23. Resoffex 19, fänr i Vendes art.reg:s res 19, ulöjtn 21, löjtn 23, kapt 40. Prakt v St Kopparb Bergsl AB :s cellulosafabr Skutskär 23—24, driftsing v Sv Oljeslageri AB Henriksdal 24—25, v Rudolph Jacobssons kem fabr 26—27, färgeritekn utbildn Danm o Tyskl samt anst v AB Lundby Skönfärgeri o Kem Tvättanst 27—28, driftsing v AB Fören Yllefabr :a Norrkp 28—34, stud spektroskopi, färgmätn mm v univ Jena 32, övering o drifts-ch v Holmens Bruks- & Fabr AB :s bomullsavd Norrkp sed. 34. Styr.led i Norrkps kommunala mellansk o h folksk. Led av luftskyddsnmdn. Sekr i Norrkps Luftv.frn. Led Sv Tekn.frn. Av trycket: Tvättn.system f sulfatmassa (Sv Papperstidn 24), Extraktionsförsök m bituminösa avlagringar fr Höganäs (IVA:s handl 25), Om färgblandning (Polhemsskr 29, publ 1 Tekn Tidskr 30), Substantivität u Färbe-theorie (Melliands Textilberichte 31), Textilindis kem hjälpprodukter (Färgeritekn 32), Bestimmung der Luftfeuchtigkeit mit dem Psychrometer (Gerlands Beiträge zur Geophy-sik 32), Some complementary colour relations (Proc Phys Soc 33), Det trikromatiska färgsystemets huvuddrag (Tekn Tidskr 33), Ekon verkn.grad (ibid 36). Resor: Finl, Tyskl, Österr, Schweiz, Jugoslav, Engl, Frankr, Belg, Holl 30—38. Hobby: Botanik.
translated: GENBERG, Erik Waldemar, Civil Engineer, Norrköping, b. in Solna, Stockholm County, on September 22, 1899, son of Colonel K A G and Gerda Högman, married to Maria Heist. Graduated from Kristianstad at 17, studied chemistry at the Royal Institute of Technology (KTH) from 1919 to 1923. Commissioned officer in 1919, second lieutenant in Vendes Artillery Regiment's reserve in 1921, lieutenant in 1923, captain in 1940. Worked practically for Stora Kopparberg Bergslagen AB's cellulose factory in Skutskär from 1923 to 1924, as a manager at the Swedish Oil Mill in Henriksdal from 1924 to 1925, at Rudolph Jacobsson's chemical factory from 1926 to 1927, received training in dye technology in Denmark and Germany, and worked for AB Lundby Skönfärgeri and Kem Tvättanst from 1927 to 1928. Then served as a manager at AB Fören Yllefabriks in Norrköping from 1928 to 1934, studied spectroscopy, color measurement, and more at the University of Jena in 1932, and became superintendent and operations manager at Holmens Bruks- & Fabriks AB's cotton department in Norrköping from 1934 onwards. Served on the board of directors of the municipal intermediate and primary schools in Norrköping, and was a member of the air defense council. Secretary of the Norrköping Air Force Association and a member of the Swedish Technical Society. His written works include: "Washing system for sulfate pulp" (published in the Swedish Paper Journal in 1924), "Extraction experiments with bituminous deposits from Höganäs" (published in the Proceedings of the Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences in 1925), "On color mixing" (published in Polhems Review in 1929 and in the Technical Journal in 1930), "Substantivity and color theory" (published in Melliand's Textile Reports in 1931), "Chemical auxiliary products for the textile industry" (published in Dye Technology in 1932), "Determination of air humidity with a psychrometer" (published in Gerland's Contributions to Geophysics in 1932), "Some complementary color relations" (published in the Proceedings of the Physical Society in 1933), "The main features of the trichromatic color system" (published in the Technical Journal in 1933), "Economic efficiency" (published in the same journal in 1936). Traveled to Finland, Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Yugoslavia, England, France, Belgium, and the Netherlands from 1930 to 1938. Hobby: Botany.
